div.div: Scheme of the cQED setup and digital-analog protocol needed for mimicking the Hamiltonian in equation (10).
div.p:
We consider a multimode cavity (red), that is, either a long resonator, a 3D cavity or a transmission line, coupled to three tunable superconducting qubits (blue). The cavity simulates analogically the bosonic bath, whereas the electrons are encoded in the superconducting qubits. The coupling between the qubits and the cavity,
, must be tunable via external magnetic fluxes
and
to enable the digital-analog quantum simulation, in which each qubit is coupled sequentially with the cavity.
